step1.sentence: I finally signed up for the gym after years of thinking about it — better late than never, right?

step2.story: Tom had been meaning to apologize to his old friend for over a year. One rainy evening, he finally picked up the phone and called. His friend laughed and said, "Well, better late than never — I'm glad you reached out."

step3.story: Sarah had always dreamed of learning to play the piano, but life kept getting in the way. At forty-two, she walked into a music school and signed up for beginner lessons. The young receptionist smiled and handed her a schedule. During her first class, she felt embarrassed sitting among teenagers, but her teacher encouraged her. "You're here now, and that's what matters," he said. Sarah smiled to herself, thinking better late than never, and pressed her fingers to the keys.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 늦더라도 안 하는 것보다는 낫다는 뜻입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 무언가를 늦게 시작하거나 뒤늦게 행동했을 때, 그래도 하지 않은 것보다 낫다는 의미로 자신이나 상대를 격려할 때 사용합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 이 표현은 고대 그리스 역사가 디오니시오스가 기원전 1세기경에 사용한 문구에서 유래했으며, 영어에서는 14세기 초서의 작품에서 처음 등장했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 가볍고 긍정적인 톤으로, 지연에 대한 변명이나 격려의 뉘앙스를 모두 담을 수 있습니다. 진지한 상황보다는 일상적인 대화에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You finally started exercising? Better late than never!
meaning.shortExampleKo: 드디어 운동 시작한 거야? 늦어도 안 하는 것보다 낫지!
